Ricky Holtz

Designer, developer, and graduate student at the UC Berkeley School of Information. On a mission to make great products and build a better web.

Skills

product design

I’m interested in the process, aesthetics, and human factors that go into awesome products.

front-end development

I think coding is pretty zen — particularly when I'm working in HTML, CSS, and Javascript.

research & writing

I know my users, communicate their needs, and create useful and lasting documentation.

Projects

dance dance

Our team designed and built a sweater that uses accelerometers to interpret dancing and display the motion using LED strips on the sweater sleeves. read more...about dance dance, a sweater that lights up while you dance.

aesthetic notes

Reviewing notes is often a really text-heavy experience. What might it look like if it were a little more visually oriented? read more... about the aesthetic note project

the light jacket

Cold San Francisco summer evenings catch too many people off guard — so, to help out, I took simple weather data and made it into a narrative infographic. read more...about the light jacket, a narrative infographic about weather in San Francisco

employee community

Sharing knowledge across an organization using siloed, web 2.0 intranets is hard. I designed a contextual employee community to help solve the problem. read more... about the employee community design project ricky did for Salesforce

nickvision

Nickelodeon is a household name, but my team was tasked with adding value to the brand. We proposed an augmented reality experience called Nickvision. read more...about nickvision, an augmented reality application concept

url shortener

I wanted to learn more about the full web stack and associated protocols, so my friend and I went ahead and built an oddball url shortener called Crisco. read more... about a url shortener project
